newsitem.title: INDIA: India needs corporate governance code - Chidambaram.
newsitem.headline: India needs corporate governance code - Chidambaram.

text.p: India is developing a code for corporate governance, Finance Minister P. Chidambaram said on Friday after launching of the country's first share depository.

"We need to have a code on corporate governance," he said at a news conference, when asked about the increasing need for such a code in light of the controversy surrounding senior officials at leading tobacco firm ITC Ltd.
Chidambaram said the government was working on a draft code.
"Companies must now recognise that they are in the glare of public scrutiny," he told reporters after the launch.
He said board members of firms should play an active role.
"We are revising guidelines of government nominees on the boards (of companies)," Chidambaram said.
"Nominees cannot be mere spectators. They must take an active role," he said.
ITC is under investigation for alleged foreign exchange violations.
